Instruction: Caramelize onions by cooking and stirring them in melted butter over medium heat in a 4-quart saucepan for about 15 minutes until well browned.

Combine sweet onion soup and consommé in the saucepan. Swirl water in the consommé can before adding it to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and let simmer for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C) while arranging Texas toast on an ungreased baking sheet.
Bake in the center of the oven until the toast is browned, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
Serve the soup in four bowls with a slice of toasted bread on top.
